meanings.definition: A person who wears a crown.
meanings.sent1: The crowner looked very regal in his golden crown.
meanings.sent2: The queen was the crowner of the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: At the costume party, everyone wanted to be the crowner and wear the crown.
meanings.sent4: In the fairy tale, the crowner ruled over the magical kingdom with a crown of stars.
meanings.sent5: The crowner's crown sparkled in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: A tool used for shaping or finishing the top of a stone wall.
meanings.sent1: The mason used the crowner to smooth out the top of the wall.
meanings.sent2: The crowner helped create a neat and even finish on the stone wall.
meanings.sent3: The crowner was so effective that the wall looked like it was made of one giant stone.
meanings.sent4: With the crowner in hand, the mason sculpted the wall into a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The crowner made the stone wall look professionally crafted and polished.

meanings.definition: The topmost part of a tree or plant.
meanings.sent1: The crowner of the tree swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: Birds often perch on the crowner of the tall pine tree.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel thought the crowner of the tree was the perfect spot to hide its acorns.
meanings.sent4: The crowner of the plant reached towards the sky, seeking the warmth of the sun.
meanings.sent5: The crowner of the tree provided shade for the animals resting below.
